Victoria Police is a large organisation employing police, public servants and protective services officers. Victoria Police provides support to the community 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year.

Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, we're a completely online company with an ecosystem of sites and services to help people get creative. In September 2014, one of our sites, ThemeForest, was the 90th most visited website in the world and it remains among the most visited Australian-owned website on the planet! With more than 350 staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers earn more than  Million ( https://envato.com/blog/milestone-celebrating-500m-community-earnings/ ).

JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and Diversity (2015 ( http://inside.envato.com/envato-coolest-company-for-women/ ) and 2016 ( http://www.searchparty.com/blog/coolest-companies-winners-2016/ )). We were also named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the 2015 ( http://press.envato.com/109596-envato-named-one-of-2015-s-best-places-to-work ),2016, ( https://envato.com/blog/best-places-work-australia-2016-envatos-17/ ) 2017 ( https://envato.com/blog/makes-envato-great-place-work/ ) & 2018 ( https://envato.com/blog/how-do-you-grow-a-company-without-losing-a-positive-culture/ ) BRW Awards.

OnEnvato Market ( http://market.envato.com ) thousands of people earn a living selling things like WordPress themes, photos, music tracks and illustrations. WithEnvato Elements ( http://elements.envato.com ), we oversee one of the world's largest subscription services for digital creatives, providing hundreds of thousands of files for unlimited download for one flat fee. We offer website design and hosting withEnvato Sites ( https://sites.envato.com/ ). On our education platformTuts+ ( http://tutsplus.com ), over 5 million people learn skills including code, illustration, photography, web design, and more, each month. We also run a freelance marketplace calledEnvato Studio ( http://studio.envato.com ). We've also just acquired Placeit ( https://envato.com/blog/placeit-joins-envato/ ), an awesome logo-builder and mockup tool, with a team based in Guadalajara, Mexico!

You might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world, we're also growing really fast!

The Role:
As a Revenue and Pricing Analyst at Envato, you will support senior management and the board by providing clear and reliable Revenue forecasts, based on a deep understanding of the commercial, pricing and competitive landscape. This is an exciting role that will allow us to better understand our trajectory across our products and shape our commercial strategy.

What you'll be doing:

Revenue modelling & forecasting
Manage the reporting and long-term forecast consolidation processes for Envato businesses
Working with the FP&A and Accounting teams to review month-end revenue numbers

Brisbane QLD -  a yearAbout QIMR Berghofer:

QIMR Berghofer is a world-leading translational medical research institute focused on improving health by developing new diagnostics, better treatments and prevention strategies, specifically in the areas of cancer, infectious diseases, mental health and chronic disorders. Based in Herston, Brisbane and working in close collaboration with clinicians and other research institutes, QIMR Berghofer is home to more than 600 scientists, students and support staff.

About the Conjoint Gastroenterology Laboratory:

The Conjoint Gastroenterology Laboratory identifies genetic and epigenetic changes that define distinct subtypes of colon cancers and premalignant polyps with the aim of predicting clinical behaviour and personalised treatment strategies. Collaboration with gastroenterologists, pathologists and oncologists is a key aspect of our research.

Role Purpose / Responsibilities :

The successful applicant will be expected to:

work as part of a team to elucidate disease mechanisms and targeted therapies
work with in vitro and in vivo tumor models.
perform cell isolation, characterization and monitoring of functional cellular responses using standard molecular biology protocols
culture organoids
contribute to laboratory management
perform immunohistochemistry and microscopy
develop ideas independently, develop strategies to design and conduct experiments and analyze and interpret data
record all experimental protocols and observations / interpretations in a timely manner
contribute to high impact publications in peer-reviewed journals

About you:

The successful applicant will have a minimum of an undergraduate degree in science with Honours Class I. The following skills and qualities would be an advantage:

Experience working with murine tumour models including administering drugs, isolation and characterisation of tumour cells
Experience in tissue sectioning and imaging
Experience in molecular biology protocols including CRISPR/Cas9 editing
Experience in lentiviral production and transduction
Ability to work independently and develop collaborative working relationships with other team members
Experience in drafting manuscripts
Highly self-motivated and career oriented individual with a genuine interest in disease mechanisms and a goal to develop novel approaches to improving outcomes for patients with cancer

What we offer:
Salary Packaging
Bonus Superannuation
State of the art facilities
Stimulating work setting focussed on cutting edge medical research
Supportive/collaborative team environment
Salary:
Salary range is  to  per annum. This is a full-time appointment for 12 months, with the possibility of extension subject to funding availability.
To Apply:
Click on the “Apply” button on the positions vacant page.
Applications should address the selection criteria and include curriculum vitae, proof of qualifications, and the names and contact details of three professional referees.
Closing Date:
25 February 2019
Further Information:
Contact A/Prof Vicki Whitehall on (07) 3362 0170 or Vicki.Whitehall@qimrberghofer.edu.au

The Role:
As a Revenue and Pricing Analyst at Envato, you will support senior management and the board by providing clear and reliable Revenue forecasts, based on a deep understanding of the commercial, pricing and competitive landscape. This is an exciting role that will allow us to better understand our trajectory across our products and shape our commercial strategy.

What you'll be doing:

Revenue modelling & forecasting
Manage the reporting and long-term forecast consolidation processes for Envato businesses
Working with the FP&A and Accounting teams to review month-end revenue numbers
Price monitoring and analysis
Business Case modelling for prioritising initiatives, including major milestones & success measures
Prepare standard and ad hoc analysis in support of pricing decision-making work with Data Platform Developers to develop/maintain availability of pricing information
Implementation of quarterly pricing reporting
Manage and/or execute ad-hoc analytics requests

What we're looking for:

MA Economics/Commerce or similar
5+ years professional experience in Pricing, Analytics, Revenue forecasting or similar
Experience with business casing and financial modelling
Financial modelling and scenario analysis skills, with an expert understanding of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Exceptional problem solving and analytical skills, in particular, understanding key financial and operating drivers of the business
Experience with SQL and either R, Python, or MATLAB a plus
Experience with Tableau is an advantage
Solid Statistics background: generalised linear models, experimental design
The ability to confidently present and defend your findings in front of a (senior) audience
The ability to make sense of complex data and translate that data into meaningful analysis, as well as the ability to report, interpret, and summarise results

What we offer


A fantastic culture ( http://inside.envato.com/a-great-place-to-work/ ) of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success
Flexible working ( http://inside.envato.com/reflections-on-remote-working/ ) conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato
We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination
A fast paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and Envato community members from all over the world ( http://inside.envato.com/reflections-on-remote-working/ )!

The Accounts Payable team are collectively responsible for central processing of payments for vendor invoices and miscellaneous payable batches. Accounts Payable Officers are expected to meet University and team expectations by ensuring all payments are made according to approved University policy and in an efficient, accurate and timely manner. The role maintains effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to the AP Team and ensures the achievement of high standards of service quality, timeliness and accuracy in service delivery.

The role contributes to the review and development of processes and procedures ensuring transactions are executed in a way that supports the achievement of high standards of service quality, timeliness and accuracy, and are in compliance with University policy frameworks and external legislative and regulatory controls.

The person
Applicants should possess degree qualifications in a commercial or quantitative discipline (IT and business, commerce) with subsequent relevant experience, or extensive experience and specialist expertise in analysing business processes and providing best practice IT solutions and/or equivalent combination of relevant education/training and/or professional experience.

You should have experience working with enterprise technology and software solutions and systems, utilising multiple user modules for the submission of a diverse range of data and information sets. Also have the ability to apply problem solving and analytical skills to investigate and ensure data integrity in transaction processing, and the resolution of any issues within the parameters of policy frameworks.

The University of Queensland values diversity and inclusion.

Applications are particularly encouraged from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples. For further information please contact our Australian Indigenous Employment Coordinator at: atsi_recruitment@uq.edu.au

Applications are also encouraged from women.

This role is a full-time position; however flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.

Remuneration
This is a full-time, continuing appointment at HEW Level 6. The remuneration package will be in the range  -  p.a., plus employer superannuation contributions of up to 17%. (Total remuneration package will be in the range of  88,869 to  95,605 p.a.)

a yearThe use of submarines and effective anti-submarine tactics is one of the most important aspects of Australia's Naval Operations. Over the years Australia has developed a conventional submarine force which is second to none in our region or the world.

The submarine's principal task is to keep Australia's maritime environment free from the threat of incursion by hostile ships and submarines. To achieve this aim the submarine may operate in conjunction with other ships as part of a task group or operate as an independent unit far from home or support. Submarines achieve their aim primarily by detecting the noise from an unknown contact. That noise source is then tracked, classified and if required, engaged with a variety of weapons. However the submarines primary weapon is stealth.

Major techniques employed for the detection of other submarines and ships include broad and narrow band detection. Broadband uses the combined noise that a contact may be putting into the water whereas narrowband analysis allows a submarine to fingerprint a contact based on specific machinery noises.

An Acoustic Analyst Submariner (known in the Navy as Acoustic Warfare Analyst Submariner) operates, supervises and manages all passive and active sonar's and acoustic sensors onboard a Collins Class submarine. An AWA SM is trained to detect, track and classify noise sources in the oceans. This information that the AWA SM provides Command is critical for the Submarine to achieve the aim.

Acoustic information which is passed to command can consist of classification of sonar contacts, tactical recommendations relating to that contact and also environmental data on how it can help us evade a threat or increase our tactical advantage over contacts.

AWA SM's come under the seamanship branch, so when the submarine is on the surface you do a variety of duties consisting of a control room watch-keeper, act as a lookout, Helmsman and standby Fire Party.

When the submarine is alongside the AWA SM branch conducts all the hull preservation work required on the submarine and any seamanship evolutions that are required.

AWA SM'S not only watch keep as sonar operators at sea they can also fill a variety of auxiliary positions consisting of navigators, damage control and survival equipment yeoman, helo transfer and boat transfer members to name just a few.

As an AWA SM you will be operating the most advanced sonar and combat systems in the RAN and as such you will have a high degree of training.

THE ORGANISATION

Based in Australia’s Capital city of Canberra, the Australian National University (ANU) is a globally recognised leader within the education sector. The University’s focus on excellence in research and education ensures their graduates are not only in demand the world-over, but also well-prepared to address complex contemporary challenges.

Joining a team committed to excellence in research, education and public policy development, this position will sit within the Australian National University Advancement Office (ADV) which leads the development, management and coordination of advancement activities within the University. ADV supports the University’s objectives to deepen relationships with alumni and secure long-term philanthropic income.

DUTIES OF THE ROLE

The Senior Analyst - Advancement Systems is responsible for the provision of business analytical services to support the maintenance, development and continuous improvement of Advancement’s Client Relationship Management (CRM) and integrated systems.

Supervise and provide effective leadership to a team that will provide configuration solutions and data integrity and enrichment services to users across the University.

Review and identify improvements to the system infrastructure and provide strategic advice, training, workshops, focus groups presentations to all stakeholders about CRM structure and processes.
Maintain knowledge of data privacy and other relevant legislation and compliance with ANU policies relation to information/data management and be responsible for applying knowledge to system administration functions of the ANU Advancement CRM system.
Comply with all policies and procedures in particular those relating to WH&S and equal opportunity.
ABOUT YOU

The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills and have the ability to lead a high performing team. They will be organised, proactive, driven and have an analytical mind.
Demonstrated experience in leading high performing teams with the ability to multi task, prioritise and meet client requirements and deadlines.
Must have prior systems knowledge with extensive experience with the Raiser’s Edge CRM and relevant University Degree with qualifications and extensive experience as a system analyst in a complex environment.
Proven technical experience in managing, implementing and maintaining enterprise system/databases, including operational frameworks.
Numerical, analytical and problem-solving skills, high attention to detail, great use of initiative, the ability to problem solve, collect and analyse data, and be confident in making system recommendations.

A high level of understanding equal opportunity principles and a commitment to these in a university context

Location & Segment Analytics

This is an opportunity with the data analytics subsidiary of a large telecommunications organisation. With a deep understanding of telco network data, they have developed innovative advanced data science methods to harvest huge amounts of big data for insights about the population and places they visit. Established in Australia since the beginning of last year, they have access to 1/3 of the population and have used this to monetise the location of people and how they move.

-  a yearThe Office of Advancement at Murdoch University is responsible for alumni relations, philanthropy and the newly formalised Advancement Operation unit. Advancement Operation is responsible for supporting and influencing the strategic plans and day-to-day operations of the Office of Advancement through expert information management, data mining and analytics, gift processing and stewardship, prospect research and management, and reporting. As a newly formalised unit, it is also responsible for establishing principles, adherence to guidelines and applying best practice and systematic solutions to minimise risk, and optimise Advancement’s operations.

The Role

The Information Management Analyst is an excellent opportunity for an analytical, outside-the-box thinker and motivated professional to add critical value to the way the Office uses engagement and philanthropic information. Under a broad direction from the Manager, Advancement Operations, this role will be responsible for data collection, management and integrity, as well as reporting and analytic support.

Skills and Experience

The preferred candidate will have:

Tertiary qualification in a relevant numerate discipline with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in information management role, or a role requiring data manipulation, analysis, management and information reporting
Demonstrated experience in working with and manipulating CRM systems.
A minimum of three years of experience analysing, interpreting and summarising complex data in a variety of formats and structures and creating clear, concise reports for management and other end users.
Demonstrated strong analytical skills, an inquisitive nature, and a strong track record of creative problem solving.
Applicants should refer to the Position Description for further detail on the duties, skills and experience required for this role.

About the Organisation
Organisation Name : Murdoch University
At Murdoch University in Perth, Australia, we're proud to have more than 22,000 students and 2,000 staff from across 90 different countries with a commitment to high quality education, innovative research, and strong community engagement both locally and internationally. With strong links to government, business and the community, Murdoch University helps people discover how to make a difference. We embrace free thinking and encourage our Murdoch community to share ideas, pool knowledge and find new ways of thinking. Prospective staff can expect to enjoy the lively, natural campus and dynamic work environment, as well as a range of benefits and services unique to employment at Murdoch. There’s never been a better time to join us.
Apply for this Job

Anneke Burlinson
Email : Anneke.Burlinson@murdoch.edu.au
APPLY FOR THIS JOB
For more information or to apply:

Please visit http://jobs.murdoch.edu.au/ to view the Position Description. Here you will also find the online form to submit your application. Please note that emailed applications will not be accepted.

An opportunity exists for an enthusiastic and service orientated Business Analyst to join the Research and Revenue Accounting Services Team. This team provides all financial services to researchers by supporting project costing and providing financial advice across the lifespan of projects. The Research and Revenue Accounting Services Team also assist in maximising grant and contract revenues.

As the Business Analyst you will be providing a range of analyst services to support the business and strategic needs of stakeholders in Research and Revenue Accounting Services. Reporting directly to the Manager of Business Processes a focus of this role is working closely with your senior stakeholders and providing advice and researching needs.

Providing specialist advice, insight and guidance for senior management researching on up-to-date knowledge and analysing in areas of technical expertise
Undertaking research income corrections and reconcile monthly Income Allocation from different departments in compliance with University and Government policy and procedure
Report development, correspondence and recommendations with advice on complex issues for a variety of audiences, including senior management
If you have a degree or experience in economics, econometric, business analytics or a related field with strong administrative skills across Advanced computer literacy packages including SAP, Power BI, TM1 and Microsoft applications then we encourage you to apply.

This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.

At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. Some positions at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check.

The successful applicant will need to possess a current valid Police Check.

Sydney NSWPermanent -  a yearEmployment Type: Permanent Full Time
Position Classification: Health Manager Level 2
Remuneration:  - 
Hours Per Week: 40
Requisition ID: REQ91844

Be part of an organisation that makes a difference in cancer control in NSW
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply
Exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to join a team specialising in data management

Where you’ll will be working

The Cancer Institute NSW is Australia’s first state wide cancer control agency, established in 2003 to lessen the impact of cancer across the state.
Working at the Cancer Institute NSW means joining a team of committed and dedicated staff who are proud to be a part of the Institute’s purpose of overseeing and accelerating the effectiveness of cancer control in NSW.
The Cancer Institute is a collaborative working environment that encourages diversity and inclusion in how we work and the way we work together. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are strongly encouraged to apply. Greater consideration will be given to suitable applicants, in order to improve access to employment and career opportunities (GSE Rule 26)


What you’ll be doing
You will have demonstrated experience in developing and maintaining data architecture, using Microsoft developer and data management tools including Microsoft SQL Server and SSIS to aid in the provision and improvement of cancer screening services in NSW and support the achievement of Cancer Plan objectives.

This is a multifaceted role providing business and technical knowledge to assist the Senior Data Analyst inform management in decision making. The role includes assisting in integrating user feedback, policy changes, evolving business needs, system upgrades and schema/ETL changes into the Screening and Prevention data architecture.


For your application to be considered
Please respond to the two pre-screening questions below and attach a covering letter and your resume addressing the essential requirements of the role which are outlined in the role description (see link below)


Please outline your experience and what your role was in any data remediation/management project or activity?

Please outline you experience and what your role was in any data warehousing activity?


Interested?

Need more information?

 1) Click here for the Position Description
 2) Find out more about applying for this position

For more information about the Cancer Institute NSW please visit www.cancer.nsw.gov.au. For role related queries or questions please contact Victor Kapruziak on Victor.Kapruziak@health.nsw.gov.au

Applications Close: Sunday 24 February 2019 at 11.59pm.


The Ministry of Health will be relocating the Cancer Institute to St Leonards in mid-2020.
The Cancer Institute NSW is unable to offer salary packaging. Salaries will be negotiated commensurate to experience and qualifications of the role.

The Cancer Institute NSW welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultural backgrounds and people with disabilities. Stepping Up aims to assist Aboriginal job applicants by providing information about applying for roles in NSW Health. For more information please visit www.steppingup.health.nsw.gov.au.

Please indicate if you have any accessibility requirements in your application or speak with the contact person should you be called for an interview. We provide reasonable adjustment for people with a disability during the recruitment process and during their employment.

To be eligible for permanent appointment to a position in NSW Health, you must have Australian citizenship or permanent Australian residency.

Melbourne VIC -  a yearPhocas is a brilliant place to work! We are proud to be rated 4.7 on Glassdoor, 30,000+ Phocas users love that our product delivers fast ROI and is truly easy to use. We have a 97% customer retention rate and are #1 in 24 categories in the largest business intelligence (BI) user survey called BARC. We rank as a High Performer on G2 Crowd, and are featured in Gartner’s Front Runner Quadrant as a top BI vendor.

We are searching for a recent IT graduate to join our Customer Technical support team as a Support Analyst. You will be someone who thrives on helping customers solve their technical issues. Our software is MS SQL server based, we use our own mapping DB creation software and various techniques to create extraction and staging layers. Our help desk software is Jira (Atlassian).

During the 24 month paid program, you will get real hands on exposure and experience across a myriad of functions and responsibilities. In return for your hard work and fresh insights, we'll provide you with the ability to accelerate your development and incremental pay increase, along with the support and guidance you are looking for to allow you to take your career in the direction you choose. While the successful applicant will not necessarily need industry or BI experience, knowledge on SQL, data points integration, databases and/or data analytics from subjects undertaken as part of your course would be advantageous. You will need to be comfortable working remotely across client sites, and, as our support function expands, be willing to work closely with our USA and UK offices.
Requirements
Be highly motivated by the opportunity to analyse technical data and process information of a technical nature
Enjoy the practical hands on aspect of industry and mechanical activities
Easily identify the important elements in routine verbal and written communications
Communicate effectively, regardless of the audience, and also capable of explaining more complex aspects so that it is easily understood
Be professional, with strong planning and mature analytical skills, and great time management
Respond well to demands on your time but most effective in a relaxed environment
Be motivated by situations where you are held accountable for results and responsible for eventual outcomes
Be a team player that enjoys helping others, you are likeable and pleasant and generally not inclined to show temper or frustration
Moderately independent you are most effective without direct supervision, but welcome some structure and supervision as needed
Function best when you use your vigilance and caution to question situations and motives
Respond appropriately to the needs of others but will prioritise your time to maximise productivity
You tend to make timely non emotive decisions based on the facts.
Benefits
We expect results at Phocas, which is why we give so much in return. In addition to your paid leave, holidays, and superannuation benefits, we provide a heap of perks which include:
Money: Competitive ‘dosh’ with a progression scale and a chance to share in our success
Fun / Fulfilling: Awesome culture and meaningful work
Autonomy: Trusted to follow your passion and make it your own
Growth: Opportunity to be more – for you and the business
Wellness: We believe in a real work life balance and have a strong family orientated culture

To all recruitment agencies: Phocas does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Phocas employees or any other company location. Phocas will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Phocas is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Therefore, the occupant will be expected to apply a combination of technical knowledge and customer service skills to support the FBS Division and University in achieving its goals.

The Accounts Payable team are collectively responsible for central processing of payments for vendor invoices and miscellaneous payable batches. The role maintains effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to the AP Team and ensures the achievement of high standards of service quality, timeliness and accuracy in service delivery.

The role contributes to the review and development of processes and procedures ensuring transactions are executed in a way that supports the achievement of high standards of service quality, timeliness and accuracy, and are in compliance with University policy frameworks and external legislative and regulatory controls.

The person

Perth WA -  a yearThe Office of Advancement at Murdoch University is responsible for alumni relations, philanthropy and the newly formalised Advancement Operation unit. Advancement Operation is responsible for supporting and influencing the strategic plans and day-to-day operations of the Office of Advancement through expert information management, data mining and analytics, gift processing and stewardship, prospect research and management, and reporting. As a newly formalised unit, it is also responsible for establishing principles, adherence to guidelines and applying best practice and systematic solutions to minimise risk, and optimise Advancement’s operations.

The Role

The Information Management Analyst is an excellent opportunity for an analytical, outside-the-box thinker and motivated professional to add critical value to the way the Office uses engagement and philanthropic information. Under a broad direction from the Manager, Advancement Operations, this role will be responsible for data collection, management and integrity, as well as reporting and analytic support.

Skills and Experience

The preferred candidate will have:

A minimum of three years of experience analysing, interpreting and summarising complex data in a variety of formats and structures and creating clear, concise reports for management and other end users.
Demonstrated strong analytical skills, an inquisitive nature, and a strong track record of creative problem solving.
Applicants should refer to the Position Description for further detail on the duties, skills and experience required for this role.

About the Organisation
Organisation Name : Murdoch University
At Murdoch University in Perth, Australia, we're proud to have more than 22,000 students and 2,000 staff from across 90 different countries with a commitment to high quality education, innovative research, and strong community engagement both locally and internationally. With strong links to government, business and the community, Murdoch University helps people discover how to make a difference. We embrace free thinking and encourage our Murdoch community to share ideas, pool knowledge and find new ways of thinking. Prospective staff can expect to enjoy the lively, natural campus and dynamic work environment, as well as a range of benefits and services unique to employment at Murdoch. There’s never been a better time to join us.

-  a yearRole Title: ICT Applications Analyst
Employment Type: Ongoing, full-time
Role Classification: Clerk Grade 9/10
Remuneration:  -  plus 9.5% superannuation and annual leave loading
Hours per Week: 35
Location: Sydney CBD
Requisition ID: REQ87714
Closing Date: 12 February 2019, 11:59pm

Background
The Health Professional Councils Authority (HPCA) is an executive agency of the NSW Ministry of Health. We play an important role in protecting the health and safety of the public by supporting the 15 NSW Health Professional Councils in managing complaints about NSW health practitioners.
An exciting opportunity currently exists for an enthusiastic and proactive ICT Applications Analyst. The ideal candidate will work collaboratively, deliver results and have good problem solving skills and a strong understanding of current technology.
What you'll be doing
In this role you will be responsible for coordinating the maintenance and support of all IT Applications and Systems. This includes identifying business requirements, implementing new systems and ensuring integration with existing systems and managing application vendors including monitoring and reporting on service levels. This role will also be responsible for developing business intelligence capacity and data, as well as information management and reporting across different systems.

The successful candidate will be responsible for:
Manage existing and/or oversee the implementation of new applications; ensuring projects are completed on time, on budget, to quality standards, and within agreed scope.
Develop and manage scope of change requests for applications and systems in line with the business needs and policy statements. You will be responsible for design, development, implementation of the change through a formal change control mechanism, risk and issue management process. Oversee audits of the system ensuring the optimal accuracy, integrity, compliance with NSW Health and overall NSW Government policies and security of data.
Provide technical support to assist in the resolution of reported user issues, including problem analysis, escalation to third party application specialists / vendors, ensuring that problem resolution is managed accordance with agreed service levels appropriately to minimise user / system downtime.
Analyse, monitor and report on current applications and business systems performance and trends in services, data or applications.
Manage and monitor the exchange of electronic information and data between the HPCA and Councils and external agencies including implementing change to drive efficient and secure transfers.
Extract data reports from business systems and review information to support the identification of trends, system pain points and opportunities for business improvement across the business.
Develop, maintain and update relevant policies, guidelines, user manuals and standards and provide advice to the management and staff on compliance obligations, business practices and procedures and deliver training to staff.

Essential Requirements
Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline or significant demonstrated experience with ICT service delivery within medium / large organisations,
Experience with service management systems, continuous improvement mechanisms and service level agreements,
Experience in business and technical change management and release management for business applications.
Benefits
This role offers the successful candidate an exciting opportunity to further develop and enhance their skills. The HPCA offers flexible working hours, and a supportive work environment. The position is based at the newly refurbished HPCA Pitt Street offices, located only a short walking distance from Central Station and Belmore Park. There are a number of facilities located within the building, including a food court, a rooftop garden, Yoga and Pilates sessions, bike storage and other amenities. The HPCA upholds NSW Health CORE values of Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment.
Need more information?

Click here for the Role Description
Find out more about applying for this position
All applicants must attach a response to the two targeted questions (1-2 pages) and your CV (no more than 5 pages)
Please note that you cannot apply for this role using iworkfornsw, please click here to access the advert through the Health Career Portal.

For role related queries or questions please contact Peter Bate, Principal ICT Enterprise Architect and Solutions Delivery pbate@hpca.nsw.gov.au

TARGETED QUESTIONS

Please give an example of how you overcame conflicting priorities in a project that you recently managed. What was the outcome?
Demonstrate a recent example of developing electronic forms, either through an online platform or a custom solution, and how have you applied this skill in your work environment?
The Ministry of Health values diversity and is committed to building an inclusive workplace culture that reflects the community we serve. We encourage applications from diverse community groups including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTI, people with a disability and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

To be eligible for employment in these roles you must be one of the following:
an Australian Citizen, ora permanent resident of Australia, ora New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand Passport, ora citizen of another country with an appropriate visa that allows you to work in Australia
You can only be offered employment in this role for the duration that your current visa allows you to work in Australia, and you can only be offered ongoing employment if you have a permanent visa that allows you to work in Australia.

To learn more about working at the Ministry of Health, please visit our career portal.

Melbourne City Centre VIC -  a yearJob posted:
11/02/2019
Applications close:
03/03/2019 (Midnight) 20 days remaining
Today
Job Description
The Victorian Institute of Forensic Medicine is Australia’s most comprehensive forensic medical facility. We serve the Victorian community and the whole of the Victorian justice system, especially the courts. We provide the justice system with evidence to underpin safe convictions and appropriate acquittals. Our doctors help investigate deaths reported to the Coroner, examine alleged offenders and assess, treat and support victims of crime. The Donor Tissue Bank of Victoria supports patients and their families by providing safe tissues for transplantation and medical research. We embrace diversity and strive to have a workforce that reflects the community we serve. We’re all about recruiting the best people, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation or cultural background. If you think you can do the job and would be a good fit for our organisation, we’d love to hear from you. If you’re having any trouble viewing this ad and would like it or any attachments in an accessible format (such as large print), please don’t hesitate to get in touch with the contact person listed on the ad. For more information on working with us and our recruitment process, please visit justice.vic.gov.au/careers If a career that can give you the opportunity to contribute to a safe and just Victoria appeals to you, we look forward to hearing from you.

Are you a data guru looking for a greenfield role?
Would you like the opportunity to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business improvements?
Do you want to make a difference at Australia's premier forensic medical and scientific services institute?
We are seeking a Data Analyst to work in the Information and Communication Technology team to lead the provision of data management services. You have a passion to present clear and concise data, which complements your ability to communicate to your stakeholders.

To be successful in this position, you will have:

Ability to set up a data management function.
Proven ability to undertake statistical analysis, analyse complex data sets and prepare high quality reports.
Demonstrated experience with BI Tools.
Experience in providing leadership and advice on data governance, policy and processes.
Strong capacity for systematic thinking and ability to analyse information and situations, identify issues, gaps, assess impacts and propose options/recommendations based on sound rationale.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to prepare clear and accurate reports and recommendations on complex issues.
Excellent organisational and self-management skills with the ability to plan, prioritise and deliver work.
Proven experience in writing complex SQL queries.
Tertiary qualifications (degree or higher) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology or related field.
Note: this is a full-time, ongoing position.

Candidate Information

Candidates should be aware that due to the nature of the work that VIFM undertakes, staff will be exposed to equipment, content and concepts of a potentially confronting nature, such as forensic material, descriptions and images, medical reports, and mortuary/laboratory environments.
Further information about VIFM's work can be found at www.vifm.org.
Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Australia (ie. Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident, or hold a valid work permit or visa) to apply for this position.
Application process

Applications should include:

your resume
a cover letter
a document addressing the selection criteria listed in the position description (maximum 1-2 paragraphs per SC)
Applications are due by 11:59pm on Sunday 3 March 2019.

Sydney NSW -  a yearRole Title: ICT Applications Analyst
Employment Type: Ongoing, full-time
Role Classification: Clerk Grade 9/10
Remuneration:  -  plus 9.5% superannuation and annual leave loading
Hours per Week: 35
Location: Sydney CBD
Requisition ID: REQ87714
Closing Date: 12 February 2019, 11:59pm

Background
The Health Professional Councils Authority (HPCA) is an executive agency of the NSW Ministry of Health. We play an important role in protecting the health and safety of the public by supporting the 15 NSW Health Professional Councils in managing complaints about NSW health practitioners.
An exciting opportunity currently exists for an enthusiastic and proactive ICT Applications Analyst. The ideal candidate will work collaboratively, deliver results and have good problem solving skills and a strong understanding of current technology.
What you'll be doing
In this role you will be responsible for coordinating the maintenance and support of all IT Applications and Systems. This includes identifying business requirements, implementing new systems and ensuring integration with existing systems and managing application vendors including monitoring and reporting on service levels. This role will also be responsible for developing business intelligence capacity and data, as well as information management and reporting across different systems.

The successful candidate will be responsible for:
Manage existing and/or oversee the implementation of new applications; ensuring projects are completed on time, on budget, to quality standards, and within agreed scope.
Develop and manage scope of change requests for applications and systems in line with the business needs and policy statements. You will be responsible for design, development, implementation of the change through a formal change control mechanism, risk and issue management process. Oversee audits of the system ensuring the optimal accuracy, integrity, compliance with NSW Health and overall NSW Government policies and security of data.
Provide technical support to assist in the resolution of reported user issues, including problem analysis, escalation to third party application specialists / vendors, ensuring that problem resolution is managed accordance with agreed service levels appropriately to minimise user / system downtime.
Analyse, monitor and report on current applications and business systems performance and trends in services, data or applications.
Manage and monitor the exchange of electronic information and data between the HPCA and Councils and external agencies including implementing change to drive efficient and secure transfers.
Extract data reports from business systems and review information to support the identification of trends, system pain points and opportunities for business improvement across the business.
Develop, maintain and update relevant policies, guidelines, user manuals and standards and provide advice to the management and staff on compliance obligations, business practices and procedures and deliver training to staff.

Essential Requirements
Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline or significant demonstrated experience with ICT service delivery within medium / large organisations,
Experience with service management systems, continuous improvement mechanisms and service level agreements,
Experience in business and technical change management and release management for business applications.
Benefits
This role offers the successful candidate an exciting opportunity to further develop and enhance their skills. The HPCA offers flexible working hours, and a supportive work environment. The position is based at the newly refurbished HPCA Pitt Street offices, located only a short walking distance from Central Station and Belmore Park. There are a number of facilities located within the building, including a food court, a rooftop garden, Yoga and Pilates sessions, bike storage and other amenities. The HPCA upholds NSW Health CORE values of Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment.
Need more information?

Click here for the Role Description
Find out more about applying for this position
All applicants must attach a response to the two targeted questions (1-2 pages) and your CV (no more than 5 pages)
Please note that you cannot apply for this role using iworkfornsw, please click here to access the advert through the Health Career Portal.

For role related queries or questions please contact Peter Bate, Principal ICT Enterprise Architect and Solutions Delivery pbate@hpca.nsw.gov.au

TARGETED QUESTIONS

Please give an example of how you overcame conflicting priorities in a project that you recently managed. What was the outcome?

Federal Government organisation
The Process Analyst will be responsible for the mapping, analysing and improving internal and externally facing processes across the agency.

In this role, you will provide expertise in process engineering, within a service delivery environment, to the business areas.

As Your team will oversee the development of new processes, process maps and technological design to ensure improvements to participant and provider pathways are scalable and understood by the agency and Partners in the Community, as well as identify opportunities for continuous improvement across all business processes.

Particular focus will be required across multiple processes conducted at the regional level. You will be part of a team tasked to map and improve current process in the participant and provider pathways and corporate functions, and assist with the design of new processes, as improvements to the pathways are piloted and rolled out, nationally.

You will have experience in a number of delivery methodologies such as Lean Six Sigma, Agile, PRINCE2 and Human Centred Design etc.

Your duties:

Review assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks relating to the Strategic Program.

Be responsible for performing gap analysis on existing written procedures.

Facilitate and support workshops, working with stakeholders to develop current and future state process maps and identify opportunities to improve the processes, resulting in better participant experience.

Work with the Business Owners to gain agreement on potential future state solutions and implement prioritised 'To-Be' processes and embed lasting process change.

Collaborate closely with the Process Optimisation Branch to align to enterprise wide standards, architecture, implementation methodology and tools.

Skills required:

Lean Six Sigma - minimum Green Belt qualification

Minimum 3-5 years:

o hands on process mapping and documentation experience

o re-engineering and continuous improvement experience

Experience with Business Process Modelling tools and notation standards e.g. ARIS, Visio, BPMN 2.0

Proven experience working with Finance and procurement departments to achieve process improvements

Excellent technical skills within finance systems such as SAP, TM1

Strong knowledge of finance and accounting policies within NDIA

Highly developed ability to synthesise and analyse complex information and make decisions.

Supervision/coaching experience.

High level of competency in consistently applying assessment tools to identify support needs.

Work closely across teams (within the region or nationally) to manage service delivery performance.

Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills to develop and maintain networks.

Ability to manage service delivery performance.

Job Description
Business Partnering Branch performs the relationship management role between the Corporate Finance Department (CFD) and the Departments, Commands and Regions of Victoria Police.This relationship management has two perspectives; to support and assist the Departments, Commands and Regions, and to provide support and advice to the Chief Finance Officer, Deputy Secretary, Corporate & Regulatory Services and Executive Command (both directly and through Business Partnering Branch functions).Business Partnering facilitates and provides business support activities, such as monthly financial management reporting, business policy compliance and analysing business results at Department, Command and Regional level.
Business Partnering also consolidates this information to provide portfolio level information, through liaison with the relevant areas, to the Deputy Commissioners and the Deputy Secretary of Corporate and Regulatory Services.

Business Partnering also assist with:

governance processes such as submissions (e.g. cost pressures, new initiatives);
the provision of transactional analysis;
the determination of allocated budgets within Departments, Regions and Commands (D/R/C); and
identification and monitoring of potential savings, including policy or service level/type changes.
Your duties will include:

Relationship management with the business areas.
Budget Monitoring & Reporting
Make available a suite of budget management reports to enable effective management by budget managers accessed directly from EIS (Oracle);
Undertake monthly variance analysis;
Identify budget variances requiring analysis / explanations; and
Review forecasting analysis undertaken by the business areas.
Financial Administration
Maintain oversight of all material actual journals that may impact budget reporting.
Strategic budget advice
Develop understanding of the business areas strategic priorities and key issues;
Provide a consultative service to business areas during the preparation of the business plan; and
Communicate relevant budget requirements and timelines.
Quality assurance and compliance activities
Provide advice on budget and funding issues and provide processes to solve each issue; and
Provide support on financial implications of key management decisions ahead of business areas drafting submissions.
As the successful applicant, you will have:

A tertiary qualification in a relevant field such as commerce, finance, accounting or economics is highly desired
Requirements and relevant information:

Two (2) full time, ongoing positions available.
Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa.
Your application must include:

Resume, and;
Response to the Key Selection Criteria – found in the position description attached to the job advertisement
Applications close midnight, Sunday 24 February 2019 - No applications will be accepted via email.

For further information on this role please contact: Angelo Christo on (03) 9247 6847 or via email angelo.christo@police.vic.gov.au.

If you have a disability/medical condition and require a copy of this advertisement and attached documentation in an accessible format or would like to discuss an access requirements/reasonable adjustment for the recruitment process, please contact VPS Recruitment via email VPSRECRUITMENT@police.vic.gov.au.

About Us:

Victoria Police is a large organisation employing police, public servants and protective services officers. Victoria Police provides support to the community 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year.

At Victoria Police our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We continually seek to attract and retain a diverse workforce which includes people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage.

Find out what it is like working as a Victorian Public Servant for Victoria Police: http://www.policecareer.vic.gov.au

You will be part of a team tasked to map and improve current process in the participant and provider pathways and corporate functions, and assist with the design of new processes, as improvements to the pathways are piloted and rolled out, nationally.

You will have experience in a number of delivery methodologies such as Lean Six Sigma, Agile, PRINCE2 and Human Centred Design etc.

Your duties:

Review assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks relating to the Strategic Program.

Be responsible for performing gap analysis on existing written procedures.

Facilitate and support workshops, working with stakeholders to develop current and future state process maps and identify opportunities to improve the processes, resulting in better participant experience.

Work with the Business Owners to gain agreement on potential future state solutions and implement prioritised 'To-Be' processes and embed lasting process change.

Collaborate closely with the Process Optimisation Branch to align to enterprise wide standards, architecture, implementation methodology and tools.

Skills required:

Lean Six Sigma - minimum Green Belt qualification

Minimum 3-5 years:

o hands on process mapping and documentation experience

o re-engineering and continuous improvement experience

Experience with Business Process Modelling tools and notation standards e.g. ARIS, Visio, BPMN 2.0

Proven experience working with Finance and procurement departments to achieve process improvements

Excellent technical skills within finance systems such as SAP, TM1

Strong knowledge of finance and accounting policies within NDIA

Highly developed ability to synthesise and analyse complex information and make decisions.

Supervision/coaching experience.

High level of competency in consistently applying assessment tools to identify support needs.

Work closely across teams (within the region or nationally) to manage service delivery performance.

Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills to develop and maintain networks.

Ability to manage service delivery performance.

a yearPermanent
Provide registration, administration and assessment support in our Misconduct & Breach Reporting team
Full-time ongoing opportunity based in Brisbane CBD
Competitive salary from  (depending on experience) with 15.4% superannuation

At ASIC there is a reason for everything we do, every law we regulate, every action we take, every interaction we have with industry and consumers. We're proud of the difference we make to Australia's economic reputation and wellbeing.
The team
Misconduct and Breach Reporting is a national team of lawyers and analysts responsible for the assessment and action on reports of alleged misconduct and breach notifications received by ASIC from members of the public and regulated businesses. The team assesses complaints and reports of misconduct relating to financial services, credit, corporate governance and insolvency as well as insider trading, continuous disclosure and market manipulation, for consideration of enforcement or other action which is critical to ASIC's work in maintaing consumer confidence and market integrity.

The role

As an Analyst, you will be required to:

assess applications for Assetless Administration Funding and Statutory reports, and support the work of Assessment & Intelligence more widely
accurately and efficiently register a range of new activities into ASIC's databases including reports of misconduct, breach reports and licensing applications
review, assess and manage general enquiries, applications for Assetless Administration Funding, statutory reports and other activities
provide administration support including preparation of virtual files, management of the team's mail
coordinating inquiries using databases and through liaison with internal and external stakeholders to assess matters

About you
To be successful in this role, you will require a high school/secondary education certificate or diploma, a tertiary qualification is not a prerequisite.
Ideally, you will have previous customer service experience, highlighting your advanced stakeholder engagement and communicative abilities.
We are looking for an individual with demonstrated ability to follow procedures and defined processes accurately and in a timely manner.

About ASIC
At ASIC there is a reason for everything we do, every law we regulate, every action we take, every interaction we have with industry and consumers. We're proud of the difference we make to Australia's economic reputation and wellbeing.
ASIC can offer you a variety of interesting and challenging work. We provide the support for our employees to develop professionally and succeed. ASIC offers a range of programs such as flexible work practices and development programs which include a focus on gender equity and women in leadership.
ASIC is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace where the very best talent in Australia chooses to work. We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply, including Indigenous Australians and people with a disability.
To work with us, you must be an Australian citizen, and be prepared to complete an ASIC Organisational Suitability Assessment (OSA) in addition to obtaining a Government Security Clearance which is issued by the Australian Government Security Vetting Agency (AGSVA).
Please view the position description for more information or click ‘apply' to start your application.

Cubiko is a new cloud based software solution which draws data from across practice management, accounting and staff rostering systems to produce dashboards customised to the needs of Practice Owners, Practice Managers, Doctors, Nurses and Receptionists. You love innovating things and making the difference in health industry. You’re approachable, dependable and genuine and you care about getting to know people. a yearPermanentThe Company

Our client is a well-respected, leading company in its field, and ongoing expansion nationally, as well as internationally has crafted an exciting opening for a Financial Accountant to join their growing ranks. This exciting team environment offers you a phenomenal work space/office, excellent benefits and sought-after opportunities either within, or outside of this business and if you are successful in your application, you will join a hardworking and high-performance team with varied strengths. 1 st movers from public practice as well as those experienced in commerce & industry will be considered, making this an exceptional opportunity to grow your career.

The Role

As the Financial Accountant, you will be responsible the preparation of month-end accounts including management reporting, analysis and complex reconciliations. You will take on an operational focus and have a lot of stakeholder engagement with Financial Analysts, Managers throughout the business as well as external customers. In addition you will assist in the preparing of statutory financial reports, provide assistance to auditors.

Your business insights will be challenged as you reconcile discrepancies by checking all possible sources of disagreement, reconstructing probable actions, and recognising the effect on other accounts. There is plenty of scope for your talents to shine as you assist in budgetary controls and contribute to special projects.

Your Skills & Experience

Degree qualified in Commerce, Business or related field.

CPA or CA or very close to attaining membership to a professional accounting body

Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel preferred.

Extraordinary ability to multi-task and attention to detail are critical.

Forward-thinking experience in general accounting and administration support.

Excellent eye for detail and dedication to accuracy.

Strong communication skills to explain ideas to a variety of colleagues.

About You

You have extraordinary skills with numbers, a real passion for pinpoint accuracy and an unparalleled knack for catching out meaningful details. You have the people skills to work as part of a team and the self-motivation to work independently. You understand the importance of deadlines, and your excellent communication skills let you explain financial concepts to colleagues that may not have an accounting background. Your creative outlook allows you to take on problems with an innovative approach.

What's on offer?

An exceptional chance to advance your career with a growth-oriented company.

A fast-paced and ever-changing work environment.

A challenging and dynamic workplace.

A supporting employer offering extensive training and a defined career path.

A super-modern workplace with a company that supports work-life balance.

Robert Half Ltd is committed to equal opportunity and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of categories protected under local law.

jobtitle: Researcher and Data Analyst - Superannuation Consumers’ Centre
job_desc:
Marrickville NSW 2204Contract a yearCHOICE and the Superannuation Consumers’ Centre (SCC) are searching for a Researcher & Data Analyst to uncover information to help us protect the interests of people on low and middle incomes in Australia’s superannuation system.

About you

First and foremost, you’re looking for a role where you can use your skills to make a difference.

Know how to find, collect and analyse data.
Have previously designed and delivered insightful and credible research projects.
Can manage multiple projects and deliver on time, working with a team to make sure you will have maximum impact.
Deliver results in clear formats and can communicate your findings succinctly and powerfully.
Have a relevant degree where you have likely specialised in financial data economics, business analytics or financial econometrics.
Be comfortable with software that helps you analyse data like Q or SPSS.
About the role

You will be employed by CHOICE and be part of a dedicated team on superannuation issues. You will report to the Head of Advocacy & Campaigns (SCC) and work alongside of an Investigative Journalist and Policy and Communications Assistant. Your role will involve analysing issues to help with advocacy priorities and to help individual consumers better understand and navigate the super.

About the SCC and CHOICE

The SCC is the peoples’ advocate in superannuation. We work to advance and protect the interests of people on low and middle incomes in Australia’s superannuation system. The SCC has been brought into existence to be a strong, fearless voice for people with superannuation savings.

The SCC has partnered with Australia’s leading consumer advocate, CHOICE, to deliver a program of work over three years.

Together we will change the superannuation system using:

Campaigning and policy: Using real people’s stories we shine a light on the biggest problems in superannuation and hold industry and government to account in fixing them.
Investigative journalism: The SCC isn’t selling a product. This means we can uncover the truth about issues people are having with their retirement savings and provide practical advice to help cut through the spin.
Research and analysis: Using rigorous, conflict-free research we lift the lid on fund performance, fees and insurance. We turn this analysis into action by using it to back reform and make super easier for people to understand.

This iconic Australian retail group pride themselves on their continued success, stemming from their agile business model, innovative product offering and ability to maintain their competitive edge in an ever-evolving market. Due to their commitment to continued growth, a rare opportunity has arisen for an established Commercial Analyst with sales analysis experience to join an expanding consumer products business. The successful candidate in this role will offer reporting and analysis support to sales and other functional departments.

THE ROLE

Reporting to the Commercial Manager, as the successful candidate you will assist the Sales and Marketing departments with accurate analysis and reports around sales volume, value and trade spend on an ongoing basis, including budgets, recommendations and forecasts. You will undertake detailed analysis of sales trends, key NPDs, marketing and promotional results to enable improved efficiency in reporting and analytics for various function teams.
You will maintain data and system integrity for primary analytics and reporting tools such as SAP BPC and SAP BW, liaising with IT teams to monitor respective interfaces and raise issues where needed. You will also support the implementation and development of a new system in 2019.

THE CANDIDATE

The successful candidate will ideally be emerging from a similar Retail/FMCG/Consumer environment and bring with them a wealth of experience across sales analytics and weekly, monthly and annual reporting. They will have gained exposure to a system implementation and have the ability to manage and monitor systems and process. Demonstrating solid analytical and problem solving skills, they will work cross-functionally across the group and partner with a range of stakeholders. Our client is seeking engaging and energetic players who are keen to be part of their growth story - a brilliant opportunity to launch your career and enjoy a culture that is built on passion and fun.

For a confidential discussion, please contact Charlotte Warke on
(03) 8899 7705 or apply directly.

Melbourne City Centre VIC -  a yearJob posted:
11/02/2019
Applications close:
24/02/2019 (Midnight) 13 days remaining
Today
Job Description
Business Partnering Branch performs the relationship management role between the Corporate Finance Department (CFD) and the Departments, Commands and Regions of Victoria Police.This relationship management has two perspectives; to support and assist the Departments, Commands and Regions, and to provide support and advice to the Chief Finance Officer, Deputy Secretary, Corporate & Regulatory Services and Executive Command (both directly and through Business Partnering Branch functions).Business Partnering facilitates and provides business support activities, such as monthly financial management reporting, business policy compliance and analysing business results at Department, Command and Regional level.
Business Partnering also consolidates this information to provide portfolio level information, through liaison with the relevant areas, to the Deputy Commissioners and the Deputy Secretary of Corporate and Regulatory Services.

Business Partnering also assist with:

governance processes such as submissions (e.g. cost pressures, new initiatives);
the provision of transactional analysis;
the determination of allocated budgets within Departments, Regions and Commands (D/R/C); and
identification and monitoring of potential savings, including policy or service level/type changes.
Your duties will include:

Relationship management with the business areas.
Budget Monitoring & Reporting
Make available a suite of budget management reports to enable effective management by budget managers accessed directly from EIS (Oracle);
Undertake monthly variance analysis;
Identify budget variances requiring analysis / explanations; and
Review forecasting analysis undertaken by the business areas.
Financial Administration
Maintain oversight of all material actual journals that may impact budget reporting.
Strategic budget advice
Develop understanding of the business areas strategic priorities and key issues;
Provide a consultative service to business areas during the preparation of the business plan; and
Communicate relevant budget requirements and timelines.
Quality assurance and compliance activities
Provide advice on budget and funding issues and provide processes to solve each issue; and
Provide support on financial implications of key management decisions ahead of business areas drafting submissions.
As the successful applicant, you will have:

A tertiary qualification in a relevant field such as commerce, finance, accounting or economics is highly desired
Requirements and relevant information:

Two (2) full time, ongoing positions available.
Applicants must be an Australian Citizen, Permanent Resident or hold a valid work permit or visa.
Your application must include:

Resume, and;
Response to the Key Selection Criteria – found in the position description attached to the job advertisement
Applications close midnight, Sunday 24 February 2019 - No applications will be accepted via email.

For further information on this role please contact: Angelo Christo on (03) 9247 6847 or via email angelo.christo@police.vic.gov.au.

If you have a disability/medical condition and require a copy of this advertisement and attached documentation in an accessible format or would like to discuss an access requirements/reasonable adjustment for the recruitment process, please contact VPS Recruitment via email VPSRECRUITMENT@police.vic.gov.au.

About Us:

Victoria Police is a large organisation employing police, public servants and protective services officers. Victoria Police provides support to the community 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year.

At Victoria Police our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We continually seek to attract and retain a diverse workforce which includes people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage.

Full-time ongoing opportunity based in Brisbane CBD

At ASIC there is a reason for everything we do, every law we regulate, every action we take, every interaction we have with industry and consumers. We're proud of the difference we make to Australia's economic reputation and wellbeing.
The team
Misconduct and Breach Reporting is a national team of lawyers and analysts responsible for the assessment and action on reports of alleged misconduct and breach notifications received by ASIC from members of the public and regulated businesses. The team assesses complaints and reports of misconduct relating to financial services, credit, corporate governance and insolvency as well as insider trading, continuous disclosure and market manipulation, for consideration of enforcement or other action which is critical to ASIC's work in maintaing consumer confidence and market integrity.

The role

As an Analyst, you will be required to:

assess applications for Assetless Administration Funding and Statutory reports, and support the work of Assessment & Intelligence more widely
accurately and efficiently register a range of new activities into ASIC's databases including reports of misconduct, breach reports and licensing applications
review, assess and manage general enquiries, applications for Assetless Administration Funding, statutory reports and other activities
provide administration support including preparation of virtual files, management of the team's mail
coordinating inquiries using databases and through liaison with internal and external stakeholders to assess matters

About you
To be successful in this role, you will require a high school/secondary education certificate or diploma, a tertiary qualification is not a prerequisite.
Ideally, you will have previous customer service experience, highlighting your advanced stakeholder engagement and communicative abilities.
We are looking for an individual with demonstrated ability to follow procedures and defined processes accurately and in a timely manner.

About ASIC
At ASIC there is a reason for everything we do, every law we regulate, every action we take, every interaction we have with industry and consumers. We're proud of the difference we make to Australia's economic reputation and wellbeing.

This is a great opportunity to work in a passionate, high-performing signalling team on some of Australia’s largest railway projects.

Brisbane QLD -  a yearSenior Analyst – Advancement Systems
Based in the heart of Canberra
Full-time permanent opportunity
Paying  -  + 17% Super
THE ORGANISATION

Based in Australia’s Capital city of Canberra, the Australian National University (ANU) is a globally recognised leader within the education sector. The University’s focus on excellence in research and education ensures their graduates are not only in demand the world-over, but also well-prepared to address complex contemporary challenges.

Joining a team committed to excellence in research, education and public policy development, this position will sit within the Australian National University Advancement Office (ADV) which leads the development, management and coordination of advancement activities within the University. ADV supports the University’s objectives to deepen relationships with alumni and secure long-term philanthropic income.

DUTIES OF THE ROLE

The Senior Analyst - Advancement Systems is responsible for the provision of business analytical services to support the maintenance, development and continuous improvement of Advancement’s Client Relationship Management (CRM) and integrated systems.

Responsibilities include;
Supervise and provide effective leadership to a team that will provide configuration solutions and data integrity and enrichment services to users across the University.
Ensure that all guidelines and standards are followed, that the team are engaging with professional development networks and knowledge sharing.
Engage collaboratively with stakeholders to understand their business needs in relation to the CRM system, help review, identify, plan, document and implement improvements to the system infrastructure and solutions that align with business needs. Provide regular progress reports on all assigned work, advice on effort estimation of analysis activities and resource requirements
Review and identify improvements to the system infrastructure and provide strategic advice, training, workshops, focus groups presentations to all stakeholders about CRM structure and processes.
Maintain knowledge of data privacy and other relevant legislation and compliance with ANU policies relation to information/data management and be responsible for applying knowledge to system administration functions of the ANU Advancement CRM system.
Comply with all policies and procedures in particular those relating to WH&S and equal opportunity.
ABOUT YOU

The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills and have the ability to lead a high performing team. They will be organised, proactive, driven and have an analytical mind.
Demonstrated experience in leading high performing teams with the ability to multi task, prioritise and meet client requirements and deadlines.
Must have prior systems knowledge with extensive experience with the Raiser’s Edge CRM and relevant University Degree with qualifications and extensive experience as a system analyst in a complex environment.
Proven technical experience in managing, implementing and maintaining enterprise system/databases, including operational frameworks.
Numerical, analytical and problem-solving skills, high attention to detail, great use of initiative, the ability to problem solve, collect and analyse data, and be confident in making system recommendations.
Proven experience in planning and formulating strategies for the development of business solutions and experience in the evaluation, implementation and management of changes to business processes
A high level of understanding equal opportunity principles and a commitment to these in a university context
CULTURE AND BENEFITS
The Culture within the University is values driven, leading to the unique history of the University. The staff benefits include;
Professional and collaborative work environment
Excellent remuneration and benefits packages
17% Superannuation Contributions Annual Leave Loading
Salary sacrificing options for cars, parking, technology, childcare and more
Christmas to New Year Leave in addition to Annual Leave
Parking on campus that is less expensive than city parking
HOW TO APPLY
If this role is of interest, please submit your resume below. If you have any further questions about this role, please call Claire at 02 9279 2777.
